claims.object: Bundle of afferent somatosensory fibers from different ascending tracts in the spinal cord

surface_layer.definition: The anterolateral system is a bundle of afferent somatosensory fibers from different ascending tracts in the spinal cord.

deep_layer.mechanism: The anterolateral system carries various somatosensory information, including pain and temperature, to higher brain centers.
deep_layer.origin: Evolves as part of the somatosensory system to transmit diverse sensory signals.

capabilities: Transmitting somatosensory signals to the brain
